commit_message:
Enable python35-jobs for scciclient

This patch makes python35-jobs voting effective by replacing
python35-jobs-nv to python35-jobs, and refactored existing jobs.

Change-Id: Ic4d5378fac5458a90aaaafb42b040d3405a96686

commit_message:
Don't access `_stored_properties_data`

It seems we're accessing _stored_properties_data in some
resources. We don't need to do that as self.properties
would have the older values.

Change-Id: I68187c8986d639e1db1ae7fb3f9c2da66c70edc6

commit_message:
Availability monitoring agents support

- adds possibility to install sensu-client on all nodes
- each composable service has it's own subscription

Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@redhat.com>
Implements: blueprint tripleo-opstools-availability-monitoring
Change-Id: I6a215763fd0f0015285b3573305d18d0f56c7770

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-09-03 15:22:19.000000000', 'files': ['murano/dsl/murano_object.py'], 'message': "Object's properties deserialize was fixed

This patch prevent re-set existing MuranoObject's properties
when second step of deserialization is running.
Now '.initialize' call pass '.__initialized' boolean flag to set_property's
'dry_run' argument.

Targets-blueprint: dependency-driven-resource-deallocation
Closes-bug: #1619685

Change-Id: I16c69010d5e7c661bd2cb172da6f3aece4aac55c
"}]
commit_message:
Object's properties deserialize was fixed

This patch prevent re-set existing MuranoObject's properties
when second step of deserialization is running.
Now '.initialize' call pass '.__initialized' boolean flag to set_property's
'dry_run' argument.

Targets-blueprint: dependency-driven-resource-deallocation
Closes-bug: #1619685

Change-Id: I16c69010d5e7c661bd2cb172da6f3aece4aac55c

This patch ensures that trunk status is set to DOWN when its
parent port is unbound. This typically occurs when the instance

Change-Id: I2673d2dd2d1dfd8eaabab66c009311cf4c143734
Partially-implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms

commit_message:
Set trunk status to DOWN when parent port is unbound

This patch ensures that trunk status is set to DOWN when its
parent port is unbound. This typically occurs when the instance
using the parent port is deleted in Nova.

Change-Id: I2673d2dd2d1dfd8eaabab66c009311cf4c143734
Partially-implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms

subject: Test: make enforce_type=True in CONF.set_override
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-05 04:46:53.000000000', 'files': ['panko/tests/functional/api/__init__.py', 'panko/tests/unit/storage/test_get_connection.py', 'panko/tests/functional/gabbi/fixtures.py', 'panko/tests/unit/dispatcher/test_db.py', 'panko/tests/unit/api/test_app.py'], 'message': "Test: make enforce_type=True in CONF.set_override

Method CONF.set_override to change config option's
value with designated value in unit test, but never check
if the designated vaule is valid. Each config option has a
type like StrOpt, BoolOpt, etc. StrOpt with parameter choices
only allows values in set of choices. In short, each config
option has limitation for type and value. In production code,
oslo.conf can ensure user's input is valid, but in unit test,
test methods can pass if we use method CONF.set_override without
parameter enforce_type=True even we pass wrong type or wrong
value to config option. This commit makes sure calling method
CONF.set_override with enforce_type=True and fixes violations.

Change-Id: I2d3fc03bb2984f47f1bcae85ba78e13846b4ed57
Related-Bug: #1517839
"}]
commit_message:
Test: make enforce_type=True in CONF.set_override

Method CONF.set_override to change config option's
value with designated value in unit test, but never check
if the designated vaule is valid. Each config option has a
type like StrOpt, BoolOpt, etc. StrOpt with parameter choices
only allows values in set of choices. In short, each config
option has limitation for type and value. In production code,
oslo.conf can ensure user's input is valid, but in unit test,
test methods can pass if we use method CONF.set_override without
parameter enforce_type=True even we pass wrong type or wrong
value to config option. This commit makes sure calling method
CONF.set_override with enforce_type=True and fixes violations.

Change-Id: I2d3fc03bb2984f47f1bcae85ba78e13846b4ed57
Related-Bug: #1517839

commit_message:
[www] Use English titles in draft index

Currently only some documents in Japanese and Korean use localized
titles in the draft index page and all others are in English.
The draft index page is shared by all languages,
so it would be better to use only English.

When data[k] is None during match check, we are getting annoying
TypeError exceptions like: "TypeError: expected string or buffer".
This patch adds a check that data[k] is something the regex can do
matching.

Change-Id: I75c8f602a59a90aeb5a6973f2e9e25708194ad78

commit_message:
Fix notify filter when data item is None

When data[k] is None during match check, we are getting annoying
TypeError exceptions like: "TypeError: expected string or buffer".
This patch adds a check that data[k] is something the regex can do
matching.

Change-Id: I75c8f602a59a90aeb5a6973f2e9e25708194ad78

subject: Use method is_valid_ipv* from oslo.utils
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-05 04:25:26.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/common/ipv6_utils.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py'], 'message': "Use method is_valid_ipv* from oslo.utils

In module method netaddr valid_ipv* raise exception AddrFormatError
if address is specified as empty string. Method is_valid_ipv*
catches the exception and returns boolean value. So we'd better
use it from oslo.utils.

Change-Id: Id995d570530871f7e2b3ea0527c0c12d6c307aab
"}]
commit_message:
Use method is_valid_ipv* from oslo.utils

In module method netaddr valid_ipv* raise exception AddrFormatError
if address is specified as empty string. Method is_valid_ipv*
catches the exception and returns boolean value. So we'd better
use it from oslo.utils.

Change-Id: Id995d570530871f7e2b3ea0527c0c12d6c307aab

subject: Migrate to gate-{name}-tox-db-{envlist}-{node}
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-09-03 18:17:12.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/python-jobs.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Migrate to gate-{name}-tox-db-{envlist}-{node}

This is part of our effort to migrate jobs from ubuntu-trusty to
ubuntu-xenial.

Note that some branch conditions need to be fixed:
Our goal is that ubuntu-trusty is used for stable/liberty and stable/mitaka
only (via global regex). And ubuntu-xenial is used for newer stable
branches and master.
Thus change a not on stable/liberty condition to a stable/mitaka
condition only for the trusty job.

Fix also a minor grammar issue in a comment in project.yaml.

Change-Id: I268c36611e34d378758a4094fa7d8df7189249b4
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Andreas Jaeger <aj@suse.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Migrate to gate-{name}-tox-db-{envlist}-{node}

This is part of our effort to migrate jobs from ubuntu-trusty to
ubuntu-xenial.

Note that some branch conditions need to be fixed:
Our goal is that ubuntu-trusty is used for stable/liberty and stable/mitaka
only (via global regex). And ubuntu-xenial is used for newer stable
branches and master.
Thus change a not on stable/liberty condition to a stable/mitaka
condition only for the trusty job.

Fix also a minor grammar issue in a comment in project.yaml.

Change-Id: I268c36611e34d378758a4094fa7d8df7189249b4
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Andreas Jaeger <aj@suse.com>

commit_message:
Fix update_upper_constraints removing additional ' ' char

In update_upper_constraints the sed substitution matches on a ' ' char after
the UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE consumes.  This creates bad changes such as [1].
Compare the manual correction at [2].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/364973/1/tox.ini@17
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/364973/1..2/tox.ini,unified

Change-Id: I532150534813d23fbe9495c748ddef5e83be4739

commit_message:
Run multinode jobs on xenial and trusty

All of these jobs are non voting except for the live migration job which
was already running on xenial so this change is really low risk.

subject: Compress base container using parallel xz
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-04 14:12:58.000000000', 'files': ['vars/redhat-7.yml', 'vars/ubuntu-14.04.yml', 'vars/ubuntu-16.04.yml', 'tasks/lxc_cache_create.yml'], 'message': 'Compress base container using parallel xz

The package for pxz is installed but was not being used, so
the base container compression was only using 1 core during
compression. This change allows pxz to be used which will
compress much faster when multiple cores are available.

Change-Id: I7eee214a69762b36c9bb2b23edad5688189bb967
'}]
commit_message:
Compress base container using parallel xz

The package for pxz is installed but was not being used, so
the base container compression was only using 1 core during
compression. This change allows pxz to be used which will
compress much faster when multiple cores are available.

Change-Id: I7eee214a69762b36c9bb2b23edad5688189bb967

commit_message:
Remove network tags directly

In function _neutron_net_remove_tags, we always create tag
for container_net_id. We had already added those mapping in
network_driver_create_network, so we can directly delete the
tags mapping between Neutron network and container network.

Change-Id: I692222f5498f71918349159d4370b152d45387a6
Closes-Bug: #1620186

subject: Add __ne__ built-in function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-05 00:57:01.000000000', 'files': ['panko/storage/base.py'], 'message': 'Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave
as expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I4a4e1afaf45c06e657873e8726f72a9cec53cb78
'}]
commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave
as expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I4a4e1afaf45c06e657873e8726f72a9cec53cb78

subject: Fixed AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'decode'
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-17 15:33:16.000000000', 'files': ['oslosphinx/__init__.py'], 'message': "Fixed AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'decode'

When git cmd fails, raw_version_list is set to empty 'str' and then
we are trying to decode it. This patch moves decoding inside try/catch
block, so we are decoding return value of subprocess call, which is bytes
in Python 3.

Change-Id: Ibd2f556355a6413beb21473ebfca3b836cbc1d73
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'decode'

When git cmd fails, raw_version_list is set to empty 'str' and then
we are trying to decode it. This patch moves decoding inside try/catch
block, so we are decoding return value of subprocess call, which is bytes
in Python 3.

Change-Id: Ibd2f556355a6413beb21473ebfca3b836cbc1d73

commit_message:
Disable DEPRECATED API versions by default

API v1.0 has been deprecated for a while and v1.1 will be deprecated
soon. We shouldn't be enabling deprecated API versions by default. This
patch adds a decorator to disable deprecated APIs by default unless they
have been explicitly enabled in the environment.

Co-Authored-By: Fei Long Wang <flwang@catalyst.net.nz>

Change-Id: I62fb4d18bc6c9f5455bff0d56e42269b4590b454

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-09-01 07:59:13.000000000', 'files': ['README.rst', 'README.md'], 'message': 'Creanup redundant README.md and README.rst

Once we have a couple of typs for RADME (.md and .rst) but it makes us
hard to maintain which is the newest updated and which one we should
refer as the right docs. This patch merges the two files into .rst which
is preferred by OpenStack projects.

Plus it fixes some link errors in the doc but probaly we still need to
update this one as the correct docs in follow-up.
(I was trying to do that but it was hard finding if which ones are current
correct docs or not)

Change-Id: I31b24159d8c2200af91980357ee7deeb13f95707
'}]
commit_message:
Creanup redundant README.md and README.rst

Once we have a couple of typs for RADME (.md and .rst) but it makes us
hard to maintain which is the newest updated and which one we should
refer as the right docs. This patch merges the two files into .rst which
is preferred by OpenStack projects.

Plus it fixes some link errors in the doc but probaly we still need to
update this one as the correct docs in follow-up.
(I was trying to do that but it was hard finding if which ones are current
correct docs or not)

Change-Id: I31b24159d8c2200af91980357ee7deeb13f95707

commit_message:
Move QuietLogger and logwrap to core

1. Move QuietLogger and logwrap to core
2. Fix QuietLogger (if log level was upper, than in param,
  QuietLogger ebabled additional logging instead of pass)
3. Cover by unit-tests
4. Added missed license text
5. add *.log to gitignore

Change-Id: If842791000c76852fe1dec1e66edcc081c278b2c
Blueprint: fuel-qa-join-helpers

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

This patch set modifies lines which are importing objects
instead of modules. As per openstack import guide lines, user should
import modules in a file not objects.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

Change-Id: I9b7c8c7e37ee9861a63489f5b8fd611f2d31946e

subject: doc: Use "warning" directive instead of "important"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-31 09:50:24.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/topics/translation.rst'], 'message': 'doc: Use "warning" directive instead of "important"

"important" is a valid directive and used in openstack manuals.
However, the theme provided by oslosphinx does not highlight
"important" directive. To highlight the section, let's use
"warning" directive instead.

Change-Id: If9ab26e6236f51b2655b5815509ff65b0a09ccfe
Note: a fix for oslosphinx will be proposed.
'}]
commit_message:
doc: Use "warning" directive instead of "important"

"important" is a valid directive and used in openstack manuals.
However, the theme provided by oslosphinx does not highlight
"important" directive. To highlight the section, let's use
"warning" directive instead.

Change-Id: If9ab26e6236f51b2655b5815509ff65b0a09ccfe
Note: a fix for oslosphinx will be proposed.

vzstorage doesn't support simultaneous open from different
clients. It means you can't open qcow2 file from cinder-volume
side, if it's used by an instance on nova-compute side.
The solution is to cache QemuImgInfo instance
under <path>.qemu_img_cache for image file <path>

Closes-Bug: #1615667

Co-Authored-By: Evgeny Antyshev <eantyshev@virtuozzo.com>
"}]
commit_message:
vzstorage: fix create/delete snapshots

vzstorage doesn't support simultaneous open from different
clients. It means you can't open qcow2 file from cinder-volume
side, if it's used by an instance on nova-compute side.
The solution is to cache QemuImgInfo instance
under <path>.qemu_img_cache for image file <path>

Closes-Bug: #1615667
Change-Id: I8949ddc244e0eef699b2af224303f86507f6f30e
Co-Authored-By: Evgeny Antyshev <eantyshev@virtuozzo.com>

[{'number': 38, 'created': '2016-07-18 18:24:14.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': '[libvirt] Live migration fails when config_drive_format=iso9660

This patch enables block live migration with read-only config drive.
Basically it copies config drive to destination host prior to migration
start, so that QEMU will not try to write to read-only device and
therefore it will not raise an exception.

Co-Authored-By: Bartosz Fic <bartosz.fic@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Michael Still <mikal@stillhq.com>

Change-Id: I9ddaef658e3d9a77e4982275d7df9e56b0a5459f
Closes-Bug: #1246201
'}]
commit_message:
[libvirt] Live migration fails when config_drive_format=iso9660

This patch enables block live migration with read-only config drive.
Basically it copies config drive to destination host prior to migration
start, so that QEMU will not try to write to read-only device and
therefore it will not raise an exception.

Co-Authored-By: Bartosz Fic <bartosz.fic@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Michael Still <mikal@stillhq.com>

Change-Id: I9ddaef658e3d9a77e4982275d7df9e56b0a5459f
Closes-Bug: #1246201

- Now it is possible to deliver Fuel release configuration using the Fuel plugin
  [bp/release-as-a-plugin](https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/release-as-a-plugin)
  Using flag ``is_release: true`` in ``metadata.yaml: releases:`` section you coud
  define new fuel release.
  Also you could define ``base_release: release_template.yaml`` inside release
  description to share single template between multiple releases.
- ``*_path`` directive in is now supported in ``metadata.yaml``.
  Now you could require folder, external file or merged glob output using keys
  like ``deployment_tasks_path: 'dt.yaml'``
- It is possible to define graphs linked with plugin or releases
  directive inside ``metadata.yaml``, see the examples.
- All yaml root files is not not required except ``metadata.yaml``.
- Templates and examples for the Fuel plugins package ``v5.0.0`` are added.
- Fuel plugin builder is refactored to make all configurations traceable and
  decouple logic working with file system with validation logic and building
  logic.
  [LP1539598](https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1539598)
- Docker environment for building and creating plugins example.
- Experimental ``JSON`` manifests support added.
- Schemas are aligned with Fuel versions.
- Advanced build process reporting.
  Now FPB trying to detect all possible problems in plugin configuration
  and report them instead of failing of first of them and also could warn user
  without stopping execution.
- Now it is possible to build plugin package v4.0.0 without ``tasks.yaml``

Implements-blueprint: release-as-a-plugin
Closes-Bug: #1539598
Closes-Bug: #1552248

Change-Id: I33dd738975346b4fcdf74c820d43d72e93cf282d
Implements-Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/release-as-a-plugin)
"}]
commit_message:
Fuel plugin builder v5

- Now it is possible to deliver Fuel release configuration using the Fuel plugin
  [bp/release-as-a-plugin](https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/release-as-a-plugin)
  Using flag ``is_release: true`` in ``metadata.yaml: releases:`` section you coud
  define new fuel release.
  Also you could define ``base_release: release_template.yaml`` inside release
  description to share single template between multiple releases.
- ``*_path`` directive in is now supported in ``metadata.yaml``.
  Now you could require folder, external file or merged glob output using keys
  like ``deployment_tasks_path: 'dt.yaml'``
- It is possible to define graphs linked with plugin or releases
  directive inside ``metadata.yaml``, see the examples.
- All yaml root files is not not required except ``metadata.yaml``.
- Templates and examples for the Fuel plugins package ``v5.0.0`` are added.
- Fuel plugin builder is refactored to make all configurations traceable and
  decouple logic working with file system with validation logic and building
  logic.
  [LP1539598](https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1539598)
- Docker environment for building and creating plugins example.
- Experimental ``JSON`` manifests support added.
- Schemas are aligned with Fuel versions.
- Advanced build process reporting.
  Now FPB trying to detect all possible problems in plugin configuration
  and report them instead of failing of first of them and also could warn user
  without stopping execution.
- Now it is possible to build plugin package v4.0.0 without ``tasks.yaml``

Implements-blueprint: release-as-a-plugin
Closes-Bug: #1539598
Closes-Bug: #1552248

Change-Id: I33dd738975346b4fcdf74c820d43d72e93cf282d
Implements-Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/release-as-a-plugin)

subject: Deprecate Template.validate_resource_key_type()
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-01 22:02:39.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/template.py', 'heat/engine/cfn/template.py', 'heat/engine/template_common.py', 'heat/engine/hot/template.py'], 'message': "Deprecate Template.validate_resource_key_type()

This is a utility function for validating the types of the various fields
in a resource definition during the validation phase, prior to creating the
ResourceDefinition object, that was added in
3f16eebd06bc964975b47496a6a1ef844986edfa.

Not only does this not belong in the public interface for all third-party
Template classes, but the implementation is nonsense. The verification code
must call it with a hard-coded key from the list of allowed keys along with
the allowed types for that value, and the method checks that the key is in
the list of allowed keys. (Surprise! It always is.) Meanwhile the keys
passed by the user are not checked for invalid values.

Fortunately the validity of the data passed by the user is checked
elsewhere as a side-effect of converting the resource definitions from HOT
to cfn, so we haven't been allowing bogus HOT templates since Kilo.
In the cfn-style templates we have never checked for invalid keys in the
resource definitions (and thus we can't really start), so the current
implementation was accidentally correct.

Since this is part of the public third-party interface we can't fix it
immediately. Instead, deprecate it and override it with a sane
implementation in the common parent class of HOT and CFN templates that was
added to hold such things. We'll remove it entirely from the public
interface later.

Change-Id: Ie38e8c62c5303f72a43f24fe1ace7ce8696abde1
"}]
commit_message:
Deprecate Template.validate_resource_key_type()

This is a utility function for validating the types of the various fields
in a resource definition during the validation phase, prior to creating the
ResourceDefinition object, that was added in
3f16eebd06bc964975b47496a6a1ef844986edfa.

Not only does this not belong in the public interface for all third-party
Template classes, but the implementation is nonsense. The verification code
must call it with a hard-coded key from the list of allowed keys along with
the allowed types for that value, and the method checks that the key is in
the list of allowed keys. (Surprise! It always is.) Meanwhile the keys
passed by the user are not checked for invalid values.

Fortunately the validity of the data passed by the user is checked
elsewhere as a side-effect of converting the resource definitions from HOT
to cfn, so we haven't been allowing bogus HOT templates since Kilo.
In the cfn-style templates we have never checked for invalid keys in the
resource definitions (and thus we can't really start), so the current
implementation was accidentally correct.

Since this is part of the public third-party interface we can't fix it
immediately. Instead, deprecate it and override it with a sane
implementation in the common parent class of HOT and CFN templates that was
added to hold such things. We'll remove it entirely from the public
interface later.

Change-Id: Ie38e8c62c5303f72a43f24fe1ace7ce8696abde1

subject: Replace assertDictEqual() with assertEqual() For smaug
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-01 07:50:15.000000000', 'files': ['karbor/tests/unit/objects/test_base.py'], 'message': "Replace assertDictEqual() with assertEqual() For smaug

In unittesttools, assertDictEqual() and assertEqual() are implemented by
using '!=' operator. But assertEqual() can handle dict, list, set and so on.
So we should use assertEqual() to make the test simpler.

Change-Id: Iee06c00f644ccecb23eccc2ee6739e53f7c1dc0f
"}]
commit_message:
Replace assertDictEqual() with assertEqual() For smaug

In unittesttools, assertDictEqual() and assertEqual() are implemented by
using '!=' operator. But assertEqual() can handle dict, list, set and so on.
So we should use assertEqual() to make the test simpler.

Change-Id: Iee06c00f644ccecb23eccc2ee6739e53f7c1dc0f

commit_message:
Add precheck for ceilometer backend

Currently when set enable_ceilometer: true and enable_mongodb: no,
the deploy will fail with ceilometer database creating error.
Add a precheck to avoid this situation in both prechecks and bootstrap.

Change-Id: I2d46ef9adeb8e028f3c18e6bc2d3752cc39bcb29
Closes-bug: #1605522

commit_message:
Update driver requirement for iRMC

This patch updates python-scciclient required version number for iRMC
driver to 0.4.0 which contains the bug fix '#1561852' and miscellaneous
improvement.

Change-Id: Ia190eb8eca44e24d0d654d95ca68ba2930359294
(cherry picked from commit bffd5a882294d3d487ea437f687f89dc88e3ab32)

While porting rally to use latest workflow of keystoneclient & keystoneauth,
we forgot to fix 2 places with obtaining project_id in wrong way.

[{'number': 24, 'created': '2016-09-01 20:58:18.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/network/neutron/test_neutron_plugin.py', 'manila/network/neutron/neutron_network_plugin.py', 'releasenotes/notes/multi-segment-support-fa171a8e3201d54e.yaml'], 'message': "Add multi-segment support

Neutron ML2 mechanisms allows multiple network segments. A net-show
call with a multi-segment setup won't return a single network-type
or segmentation id. Instead it returns a list of it with a certain
hierarchy.

Co-Authored-By: Daniel Gonzalez <daniel@gonzalez-nothnagel.de>
Change-Id: I3570752920d897c11cacb9e4a0b0d012ae2ce13a
Partially-Implements: bp manila-hpb-support
"}]
commit_message:
Add multi-segment support

Neutron ML2 mechanisms allows multiple network segments. A net-show
call with a multi-segment setup won't return a single network-type
or segmentation id. Instead it returns a list of it with a certain
hierarchy.

Co-Authored-By: Daniel Gonzalez <daniel@gonzalez-nothnagel.de>
Change-Id: I3570752920d897c11cacb9e4a0b0d012ae2ce13a
Partially-Implements: bp manila-hpb-support

commit_message:
Add group snapshots - manager

This is the fourth patch that implements the generic-volume-group
bluerpint. It implements group snapshots and create group from
source in the volume manager.

It depends on the third patch which adds db and objects for group
snapshots:
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/328052/

The next patch adds group snapshots APIs:
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/361369/

Change-Id: I5191a4cd1d82cc3598d71f2460d8239bdf1869c7
Partial-Implements: blueprint generic-volume-group

commit_message:
Add binding_profile option for backends

In order to do port binding of physical ports it must be
specified which switch and switch_port are used. It is
expected for HPB that the neutron driver handles the
logic of dependent core switches.

Co-Authored-By: Daniel Gonzalez <daniel@gonzalez-nothnagel.de>
Change-Id: I08a889a3bff6289397aaed59846e893ba5df36e3
Partly-implements: bp manila-hpb-support

commit_message:
Dell SC: Failback replications limited to 5 at a time

The number of failback replications had been unlimited. If too many
were started a busy system could get bogged down. Failback replications
now limited to 5 at a time.

Change-Id: Ifccaf98fe2f136813288a89865d3a6ad4e08922f

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2016-09-01 12:43:23.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py', 'neutron/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/CONTRACT_HEAD', 'neutron/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/newton/contract/ea8d1c569973_add_binding_index_to_l3harouteragentportbinding.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/scheduler/test_l3_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/db/migrations/test_a8b517cff8ab_add_routerport_bindings_for_ha.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/scheduler/test_l3_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/scheduler/l3_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_hamode_db.py', 'neutron/db/l3_agentschedulers_db.py'], 'message': 'Allow concurrent schedule() to run on HA routers

Changeset I22ff5a5a74527366da8f82982232d4e70e455570 introduces a new
status for routers, ALLOCATING, which was intended to not inform l3
agents about HA routers that are currently being handled by a server
(either allocating resources for, or scheduling a router). This
approached turned out to have a few downsides, mainly the fact that a
router could be "locked" in the ALLOCATING state (see bug report for
details).

Instead, we're taking a different approach: a new counting index will be
added to the L3HARouterAgentPortBinding table that will help us keep
track of the amount of port bindings that are currently created (or
being created concurrently) for a HA router. This will help ensure that
a HA router will not be over-scheduled (will be scheduled to more l3
agents than allowed). An alternative approach for this is a
post-creation loop that checks if there are too many ports, and if there
are, delete the ports and back-off for some exponential amount of time.
This approach seemed better since we can be "forgiving" - as long as we
have the exact amount of ports, we're happy.

A second change that is made in this patch is the assignment of an
L3HARouterAgentPortBinding to an agent. Before, this patch, if more than
one worker has tried to create such a binding and it would already
exist, the error would be ignored. Instead, we'll take this as a sign to
make the server stop scheduling. That is, if 2 servers are trying to
schedule a HA router to the same agent, the second one that will try to
commit the transaction will know that he's too late and will stop the
scheduling attempts.

Lastly, this patch removes the unneeded return value from
auto_schedule_routers (and other functions invoked by it) and modifies
tests to check if that function actually worked by checking actual
router-to-agent bindings.

Partial-Bug: #1609738
Change-Id: I1589ed9d6514647f4167e291b3016b511c670526
'}]
commit_message:
Allow concurrent schedule() to run on HA routers

Changeset I22ff5a5a74527366da8f82982232d4e70e455570 introduces a new
status for routers, ALLOCATING, which was intended to not inform l3
agents about HA routers that are currently being handled by a server
(either allocating resources for, or scheduling a router). This
approached turned out to have a few downsides, mainly the fact that a
router could be "locked" in the ALLOCATING state (see bug report for
details).

Instead, we're taking a different approach: a new counting index will be
added to the L3HARouterAgentPortBinding table that will help us keep
track of the amount of port bindings that are currently created (or
being created concurrently) for a HA router. This will help ensure that
a HA router will not be over-scheduled (will be scheduled to more l3
agents than allowed). An alternative approach for this is a
post-creation loop that checks if there are too many ports, and if there
are, delete the ports and back-off for some exponential amount of time.
This approach seemed better since we can be "forgiving" - as long as we
have the exact amount of ports, we're happy.

A second change that is made in this patch is the assignment of an
L3HARouterAgentPortBinding to an agent. Before, this patch, if more than
one worker has tried to create such a binding and it would already
exist, the error would be ignored. Instead, we'll take this as a sign to
make the server stop scheduling. That is, if 2 servers are trying to
schedule a HA router to the same agent, the second one that will try to
commit the transaction will know that he's too late and will stop the
scheduling attempts.

Lastly, this patch removes the unneeded return value from
auto_schedule_routers (and other functions invoked by it) and modifies
tests to check if that function actually worked by checking actual
router-to-agent bindings.

Partial-Bug: #1609738
Change-Id: I1589ed9d6514647f4167e291b3016b511c670526

Nexenta: adding share drivers for NexentaStor

Share drivers to support NexentaStor4 and NexentaStor5 via
NFS protocol. Supports all minimal required features.

Implements: blueprint nexenta-manila-driver

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ib8b8525397626162968458ec837f9239ff5dbb2b

The DB model uses 'revision_number' so we should keep the API
consistent with that to avoid the hassle of writing translation
logic as we transition to OVO.

This is an API change, but the revision plugin didn't exist

Change-Id: I445974b0e0dabb762807c6f318b1b44f51b3fe15
"}]
commit_message:
Change 'revision' to 'revision_number'

The DB model uses 'revision_number' so we should keep the API
consistent with that to avoid the hassle of writing translation
logic as we transition to OVO.

This is an API change, but the revision plugin didn't exist
in the last cycle so we don't need to worry about backward
compatibility or an API impact.

Change-Id: I445974b0e0dabb762807c6f318b1b44f51b3fe15

commit_message:
Remove unused methods from volumes_client

Since I59e88344e83b8c0665a04c8ef55126a8f27bbf57 , these methods have
become unused and that was over 2 years ago. So we don't test these
APIs over 2 years.
Then this patch removes these methods before defining stable interfaces.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I0f8f16430de3fb51a02e97f19b44d983072ae15a

subject: Don't return unknown attributes through the API
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9845, 'name': 'Arista CI', 'email': 'arista-openstack-test@aristanetworks.com', 'username': 'arista-test', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12444, 'name': 'John Schwarz', 'email': 'jschwarz@redhat.com', 'username': 'jschwarz'}, {'_account_id': 14208, 'name': 'Cisco CI', 'email': 'ml2.ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_ml2_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15752, 'name': 'Intel SR-IOV CI', 'email': 'sriov-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'sriovci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-16 17:01:31.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/api/v2/base.py'], 'message': "Don't return unknown attributes through the API

Each field that is described as part of a DB model is also defined as an
API attribute. In case the plugin returns a key that is not a known API
attribute, it should be not be returned to the user (else why would the
user see it through REST?)

An example case is when a key is provided by some extension (a port has
a qos_policy) but that extension is not enabled (the qos extension is
not enabled on the server's side), then that key shouldn't be returned
to the user (the key and value of qos_policy should be removed).

Change-Id: I864d606a4155aa40f6070d7a4b56fd5ba8a0720f
"}]
commit_message:
Don't return unknown attributes through the API

Each field that is described as part of a DB model is also defined as an
API attribute. In case the plugin returns a key that is not a known API
attribute, it should be not be returned to the user (else why would the
user see it through REST?)

An example case is when a key is provided by some extension (a port has
a qos_policy) but that extension is not enabled (the qos extension is
not enabled on the server's side), then that key shouldn't be returned
to the user (the key and value of qos_policy should be removed).

Change-Id: I864d606a4155aa40f6070d7a4b56fd5ba8a0720f

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-16 17:04:18.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/api/v2/test_base.py', 'neutron/api/api_common.py'], 'message': "api: ignore unknown fields

Currently, the API controller passes all the filters that are received
to the plugin layer. In case a parameter is known, it is ignored later
down the line by the plugin itself so no harm is done. However, the
upcoming versioned objects don't ignore these unknown filters and
instead raise an exception.

This patch explicitly removes any unknown parameters that have been
accepted during the parsing of the query. This means that instead of
passing them down to the plugin and have it ignore them there, they
aren't passed at all and ignored early in the process

Change-Id: Ie79b4f4885b8646645eeb74bbd2dbf7e62adc24f
"}]
commit_message:
api: ignore unknown fields

Currently, the API controller passes all the filters that are received
to the plugin layer. In case a parameter is known, it is ignored later
down the line by the plugin itself so no harm is done. However, the
upcoming versioned objects don't ignore these unknown filters and
instead raise an exception.

This patch explicitly removes any unknown parameters that have been
accepted during the parsing of the query. This means that instead of
passing them down to the plugin and have it ignore them there, they
aren't passed at all and ignored early in the process

Change-Id: Ie79b4f4885b8646645eeb74bbd2dbf7e62adc24f

commit_message:
Use CaS for setting router's status as ALLOCATING

This patch proposes to streamline how we change a router's status to
ALLOCATING. Using "UPDATE ... WHERE", we can use this as a
Compare-and-Swap mechanism which will fail if some other thread/process
tried to do the same at the same time. This streamlined approach can
then be used to ensure that operations done on a router (specifically
resource-allocation) can be done in a safe manner.

Related-bug: 1499647
Change-Id: I09c41ffd7922005394bcb27ac0724b7ed93c4f09

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-28 11:50:09.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_hamode_db.py'], 'message': "Mark an HA router as ALLOCATING before deletion

Such a mark is required since when calling a router's delete_router,
some HA resources might be automatically cleaned up as well (thanks to
[1]). In this case, during a time where the resources are concurrently
deleted but before the router has been completely deleted, there exists
a state of inconsistency in the database (a HA router without all its
resources). This change proposes that when a router is to be deleted it
will be marked as ALLOCATING. This will allow future patches to depend
on this marking to detect if an action is inconsistent because of an
actual error or if it's simply in the middle of some
allocation/deallocation.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/274571/

Change-Id: I2ad13db9d6b2003b59997780c2e9733b5917329b
"}]
commit_message:
Mark an HA router as ALLOCATING before deletion

Such a mark is required since when calling a router's delete_router,
some HA resources might be automatically cleaned up as well (thanks to
[1]). In this case, during a time where the resources are concurrently
deleted but before the router has been completely deleted, there exists
a state of inconsistency in the database (a HA router without all its
resources). This change proposes that when a router is to be deleted it
will be marked as ALLOCATING. This will allow future patches to depend
on this marking to detect if an action is inconsistent because of an
actual error or if it's simply in the middle of some
allocation/deallocation.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/274571/

Change-Id: I2ad13db9d6b2003b59997780c2e9733b5917329b

A router may be stuck in the ALLOCATING state in some scenarios (as
described in the bug report, most obvious one is "handling
neutron-server crashed before re-setting the router to ACTIVE"). In
this case, the admin must do a series of router-update commands to fix
this issue (bringing the router down with --admin-state-up=False, then
removing the ha status and re-setting it when --ha=False and --ha=True,
and finally bringing it back up again with --admin-state-up=True).

These steps are not intuitive and the proposed change adds a new status,
"DOWN", which will be used when a router's admin_state_up attribute is
False. This will allow the user to skip the 2 steps regarding the HA
attribute of the router, and merely bring it down and back up.

commit_message:
Add new status DOWN for routers

A router may be stuck in the ALLOCATING state in some scenarios (as
described in the bug report, most obvious one is "handling
neutron-server crashed before re-setting the router to ACTIVE"). In
this case, the admin must do a series of router-update commands to fix
this issue (bringing the router down with --admin-state-up=False, then
removing the ha status and re-setting it when --ha=False and --ha=True,
and finally bringing it back up again with --admin-state-up=True).

These steps are not intuitive and the proposed change adds a new status,
"DOWN", which will be used when a router's admin_state_up attribute is
False. This will allow the user to skip the 2 steps regarding the HA
attribute of the router, and merely bring it down and back up.

Related-Bug: #1609738
Change-Id: I8784b6a499d7828d1cbcd701d91fa87477a764d8

subject: Re-schedule HA router on admin_state_up=True
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7249, 'name': 'Ann Taraday', 'email': 'akamyshnikova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'AKamyshnikova'}, {'_account_id': 7448, 'name': 'Carl Baldwin', 'email': 'carl@ecbaldwin.net', 'username': 'carl-baldwin'}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 8873, 'name': 'Assaf Muller', 'email': 'amuller@redhat.com', 'username': 'amuller'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9845, 'name': 'Arista CI', 'email': 'arista-openstack-test@aristanetworks.com', 'username': 'arista-test', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10386, 'name': 'OpenDaylight CI', 'email': 'odl-openstack@opendaylight.org', 'username': 'odl-jenkins', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15752, 'name': 'Intel SR-IOV CI', 'email': 'sriov-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'sriovci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-08 13:39:31.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_hamode_db.py'], 'message': 'Re-schedule HA router on admin_state_up=True

The current state of the code is that an HA router is scheduled to the
agents when the HA attribute of the router changes to True. This is
problematic since I22ff5a5a74527366da8f82982232d4e70e455570 introduces a
new state, ALLOCATING, for a router, and on the edge case where the
handling neutron-server crashes before changing the status of the router
to ACTIVE, an HA router may be stuck in the ALLOCATING state and it
won't get serviced by agents at all. Worse yet, this can be accompanied
by missing HA resources ("What? I have a vr_id for the router but no HA
ports have been allocated?? :<")

The manual fix for this is the non-intuitive guideline in which a router
should be brought down (--admin-state-up=False), its HAness should be
re-set (--ha=False followed by --ha=True) and then brought back up
(--admin-state-up=True). The gist of it is that the 2 steps involving
the HAness of the router are the ones that schedule/unschedule an HA
router from the agents, along with re-creating any resources that may be
missing.

Since the steps are rather not intuitive, this patch proposes skipping
the 2 steps of re-setting the HA attribute, allowing the user to fix the
bad state caused by merely bringing the router down and up again.

Closes-Bug: #1609738
Change-Id: I7a40eb0969a66153b17e2d3cae944fcbde5ab36b
'}]
commit_message:
Re-schedule HA router on admin_state_up=True

The current state of the code is that an HA router is scheduled to the
agents when the HA attribute of the router changes to True. This is
problematic since I22ff5a5a74527366da8f82982232d4e70e455570 introduces a
new state, ALLOCATING, for a router, and on the edge case where the
handling neutron-server crashes before changing the status of the router
to ACTIVE, an HA router may be stuck in the ALLOCATING state and it
won't get serviced by agents at all. Worse yet, this can be accompanied
by missing HA resources ("What? I have a vr_id for the router but no HA
ports have been allocated?? :<")

The manual fix for this is the non-intuitive guideline in which a router
should be brought down (--admin-state-up=False), its HAness should be
re-set (--ha=False followed by --ha=True) and then brought back up
(--admin-state-up=True). The gist of it is that the 2 steps involving
the HAness of the router are the ones that schedule/unschedule an HA
router from the agents, along with re-creating any resources that may be
missing.

Since the steps are rather not intuitive, this patch proposes skipping
the 2 steps of re-setting the HA attribute, allowing the user to fix the
bad state caused by merely bringing the router down and up again.

Closes-Bug: #1609738
Change-Id: I7a40eb0969a66153b17e2d3cae944fcbde5ab36b

commit_message:
Fix volume creation with no volume type

Allow creation of volumes with no volume type.  This
has always been supported but was accidentally broken
with recent changes.

If a type is not specified, the capabilities filter can
skip processing type-related checks.

This reverts most of 8a594c8 "Fix NoneType Attribute Error"

This is being backported for rolling upgrade considerations.
With c-api running Newton and c-sch running Mitaka, this
error would still persist. Adding the fix to Mitaka will
alleviate this.

Closes-Bug: #1619008
Co-Author: Tom Barron <tbarron@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I7cb8435af379099c60f0f84d7bad4a6660d2d636
(cherry picked from commit 9abeca399e3e006e1ac6e8df2ba89b007cd93eac)

commit_message:
Add error management regarding malformed UUID

Catch the exception raised by the UUID library in the case of a
malformed UUID and raise an OpenContrailMalformedUUID managed by
Neutron server logs.

Change-Id: I05dc8a380a3e5a8d54f21cef186cb532ec9461f2
Closes-Bug: #1604748
(cherry picked from commit c0eefd72c1122377f34b5fc8b5d671c41f5bf5f3)

There are two actions related to the storage backends:
- Show back-end capabilities
- List back-end storage pools

Currently, 'admin_volume_client' client is availabe for those actions,
I think we should add a new client for backends actions.
Furthermote, those API actions should exist in volume v2 admin API according to
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-blockstorage-v2.html#listPools

Change-Id: I8e07ed89eeefbe2f46c71d416b2e324302ec35f6

commit_message:
Add a new client 'backends_client' for actions related to backends

There are two actions related to the storage backends:
- Show back-end capabilities
- List back-end storage pools

Currently, 'admin_volume_client' client is availabe for those actions,
I think we should add a new client for backends actions.
Furthermote, those API actions should exist in volume v2 admin API according to
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-blockstorage-v2.html#listPools
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-blockstorage-v2.html#showBackendCapabilities

Change-Id: I8e07ed89eeefbe2f46c71d416b2e324302ec35f6

commit_message:
Move crc16 to requirements

Change I8587012c916b2108d620e8d293da6ddb8e3fc39f added crc16 to
global-requirements because of dragonflow, so use it properly.

Since crc16 is in global-requirements, remove it from tox_install
and devstack/redis_driver, add it to requirements.

Note that this is following the common OpenStack requirements process
as documented at http://docs.openstack.org/developer/requirements/

Change-Id: I5301083ceb7716c84f5f373d53f385018f092a9c

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-19 06:46:14.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_hpe3par.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/hpe/hpe_3par_common.py'], 'message': 'Handle snapshot delete conflict in 3par driver

Issue is most likely due to the fact that 3par uses online
copy during create from snapshot.   This process on the 3PAR
creates temporary snapshots for doing the copy.  They get
deleted after the online (background) copy is completed.
If user try and delete the volume during that process, user
will get an HTTP Conflict and the "volume has a child" error.

Fix is to detect conflict code and remove temporary online
copies if they exist and delete snapshot again.

Modified unit test to check HTTP conflict with error code

Closes-Bug: #1600104
(cherry picked from commit 1e8204795e240303795d49d8268233220c9455eb)

Change-Id: I0ab719db35e26cbb10946989de4c1d59bcd3071b
'}]
commit_message:
Handle snapshot delete conflict in 3par driver

Issue is most likely due to the fact that 3par uses online
copy during create from snapshot.   This process on the 3PAR
creates temporary snapshots for doing the copy.  They get
deleted after the online (background) copy is completed.
If user try and delete the volume during that process, user
will get an HTTP Conflict and the "volume has a child" error.

Fix is to detect conflict code and remove temporary online
copies if they exist and delete snapshot again.

Modified unit test to check HTTP conflict with error code

Closes-Bug: #1600104
(cherry picked from commit 1e8204795e240303795d49d8268233220c9455eb)

Change-Id: I0ab719db35e26cbb10946989de4c1d59bcd3071b

commit_message:
Config: no need to set default=None

By default oslo.cfg sets the default value as None. There is no
need to explicitly do this.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I763f3e8e76e10138317dcd52cc51b5be79a7a4f0

commit_message:
Run cell0 db migrations during nova-manage simple_cell_setup

In order for the cell0 database to be usable it needs to have db
migrations run against it. Since the simple_cell_setup attempts to be
the one command necessary to upgrade to cellsv2 it should also handle
the db migrations.

Partially-Implements: bp cells-cell0
Change-Id: I9bbaa4c92503222c9fd015fe075926b50f3dcc8c
Depends-On: I090d5994c3077d86c60457e4c16a03d35e0c409c

commit_message:
Use the latest api of NXActionRegLoad

The ryu api of NXActionRegLoad has been changed in [1][2], while the
metadata app is still using the old api.

This patch use the latest api of NXActionRegLoad to avoid the reported
issue.

[1] 3c3896fd77f274ce953dcb78795aa5cc4fde6c65
[2] 64ba9f1cdcd9314522254fb749c22fa6bcfd63dd

Change-Id: Ib986650079ed3e6ebb070a83dd6d258e5f2e5e89
Closes-bug: #1616795

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

This patch set modifies lines which are importing objects
instead of modules. As per openstack import guide lines, user should
import modules in a file not objects.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

Change-Id: I5aa415966a94bec00257c4d34bd5633de7bb34c8

commit_message:
Exclude /run from AIDE checks

The /run directory contains items that change frequently and often
change when services start/stop or the system reboots. This patch
excludes the /run directory from AIDE checks.

Closes-bug: 1617343
Backport-of: Ic915d4821c8a90c613c5822c6d54c2f7ab54da16
Change-Id: Ib74d6ec24991039299b3ad2c2d550f488fc463ba

subject: Ensure AIDE initializes on subsequent runs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-30 12:33:47.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/aide.yml', 'handlers/main.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/aide-initialization-fix-16ab0223747d7719.yaml', 'tasks/misc.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Ensure AIDE initializes on subsequent runs

If a deployer installs AIDE the first time they apply the role
without initializing AIDE and they want to initialize it later,
the handler that does the initialization never fires.

This patch does a few things:

  - Ensures AIDE initialization if the initialize_aide bool is True
  - Doesn't intialize the AIDE db if it already exists
  - Moves the new db into place on Red Hat systems
  - Moves the AIDE tasks into its own file with tags
  - Prevents AIDE from trawling through /var

Manual backport of two reviews:
  * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/359554/
  * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/361460/

Closes-Bug: 1616281
Backport-of: I170eb3898b4336333b1fbe663ec4f069823898e0
Change-Id: Iaedcce1d6416f2224f44376336c23702e6152a00
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure AIDE initializes on subsequent runs

If a deployer installs AIDE the first time they apply the role
without initializing AIDE and they want to initialize it later,
the handler that does the initialization never fires.

This patch does a few things:

  - Ensures AIDE initialization if the initialize_aide bool is True
  - Doesn't intialize the AIDE db if it already exists
  - Moves the new db into place on Red Hat systems
  - Moves the AIDE tasks into its own file with tags
  - Prevents AIDE from trawling through /var

Manual backport of two reviews:
  * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/359554/
  * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/361460/

Closes-Bug: 1616281
Backport-of: I170eb3898b4336333b1fbe663ec4f069823898e0
Change-Id: Iaedcce1d6416f2224f44376336c23702e6152a00

When running dedicated replication network we need the auditor service

Without this we will get errors in the various servers indicating the
replicator service can not be found by the auditor service:

object-auditor: STDOUT: Unable to find object-replicator config section

commit_message:
Point auditor service at the replicator config

When running dedicated replication network we need the auditor service
to point at the configuration file with the replicator.

Without this we will get errors in the various servers indicating the
replicator service can not be found by the auditor service:

object-auditor: STDOUT: Unable to find object-replicator config section
in /etc/swift/object-server/object-server.conf

commit_message:
Disable martian logging by default

This patch disables martian packet logging and updates the
documentation to reflect the new default. A release note
is also included to make deployers aware of the change.

Closes-bug: 1619039
Change-Id: I4b19aa1200298a92c85824e319bb919260e5a6d0

Remove cinder/tests/unit/test_misc.py

more.
2. ExceptionTestCase moved to cinder/tests/unit/test_exception.py

subject: Raise NotImplementedError instead of NotImplemented
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-03 03:14:58.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/identity/v3/base.py', 'keystoneauth1/extras/_saml2/v3/saml2.py', 'keystoneauth1/loading/base.py', 'keystoneauth1/identity/v3/oidc.py'], 'message': 'Raise NotImplementedError instead of NotImplemented

NotImplementedError is the name of the exception
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/exceptions.html).
NotImplemented is the name of a constant
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/constants.html).
>>> raise NotImplemented()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<pyshell#31>", line 1, in <module>
    raise NotImplemented()
TypeError: 'NotImplementedType' object is not callable
>>> raise NotImplementedError()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<pyshell#32>", line 1, in <module>
    raise NotImplementedError()
NotImplementedError

This patch fix it.

Change-Id: Ieb53a2833b9678ce6a696dfa7e783668994a5cdc
Closes-Bug: #1339855
'}]
commit_message:
Raise NotImplementedError instead of NotImplemented

NotImplementedError is the name of the exception
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/exceptions.html).
NotImplemented is the name of a constant
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/constants.html).
>>> raise NotImplemented()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<pyshell#31>", line 1, in <module>
    raise NotImplemented()
TypeError: 'NotImplementedType' object is not callable
>>> raise NotImplementedError()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<pyshell#32>", line 1, in <module>
    raise NotImplementedError()
NotImplementedError

This patch fix it.

Change-Id: Ieb53a2833b9678ce6a696dfa7e783668994a5cdc
Closes-Bug: #1339855

commit_message:
Raise NotImplementedError instead of NotImplemented

NotImplementedError is the name of the exception
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/exceptions.html).
NotImplemented is the name of a constant
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/constants.html).

>>> raise NotImplemented()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<pyshell#31>", line 1, in <module>
    raise NotImplemented()
TypeError: 'NotImplementedType' object is not callable
>>> raise NotImplementedError()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<pyshell#32>", line 1, in <module>
    raise NotImplementedError()
NotImplementedError
This patch fix it.

Change-Id: I4f9ed5297657f83818175021573187c2ef6d5042
Closes-Bug: #1339855

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

commit_message:
Create NetIpListMap for all roles

This allows us to create $service_node_ips and $service_node_names
hiera entries for services not deployed on the Controller role.

Co-Authored-By: Thomas Herve <therve@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I688618dda05ff908293c32b9d8518697d57e9eb0
Partially-Implements: blueprint custom-roles

commit_message:
Remove hard-coded per-service rabbitmq hieradata

To avoid the hard-coded references which won't work with
composable roles, we instead default to the rabbitmq_node_ips
list in the per-service puppet-tripleo profiles.

Change-Id: I76b7e06781fdd5d969503b6d73423bb3f5f7a41f
Depends-On: Ie53c93456529420588eb1927703ea91b54095d87
Partially-Implements: blueprint custom-roles

subject: Add validation for parameters
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-31 17:26:31.000000000', 'files': ['toscaparser/tests/test_toscatpl.py', 'toscaparser/elements/constraints.py', 'toscaparser/tests/test_functions.py', 'toscaparser/tests/data/topology_template/definitions.yaml', 'toscaparser/tests/data/topology_template/system.yaml', 'toscaparser/tests/test_toscatplvalidation.py', 'toscaparser/parameters.py', 'toscaparser/topology_template.py', 'toscaparser/common/exception.py', 'toscaparser/tests/data/test_tosca_normative_type_by_shortname.yaml'], 'message': 'Add validation for parameters

Add validation for all parameters and modification related test cases:
  1. Add property of required in Input class;
  2. For all required inputs which have not default value, must
provide parameters when instantiated a template;
  3. For all required inputs which have default value, may not provide
parameters when instantiated a template;
  4. For all not required inputs, must process the logical of no
parameters in template design(may provide default value, const value, or
process case for none input).

bp: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tosca-parser/+spec/tosca-input-validation

Change-Id: I5a4a4343f978f387f1b47d36b2210fbcfe7f1b28
Signed-off-by: shangxdy <shang.xiaodong@zte.com.cn>
'}]
commit_message:
Add validation for parameters

Add validation for all parameters and modification related test cases:
  1. Add property of required in Input class;
  2. For all required inputs which have not default value, must
provide parameters when instantiated a template;
  3. For all required inputs which have default value, may not provide
parameters when instantiated a template;
  4. For all not required inputs, must process the logical of no
parameters in template design(may provide default value, const value, or
process case for none input).

bp: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tosca-parser/+spec/tosca-input-validation

Change-Id: I5a4a4343f978f387f1b47d36b2210fbcfe7f1b28
Signed-off-by: shangxdy <shang.xiaodong@zte.com.cn>

subject: Move bandit to pep8
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 10980, 'name': 'Doug Wiegley', 'email': 'dougwig@parkside.io', 'username': 'dougw'}, {'_account_id': 11628, 'name': 'Michael Johnson', 'email': 'johnsomor@gmail.com', 'username': 'johnsom'}, {'_account_id': 11685, 'name': 'Stephen Balukoff', 'email': 'stephen@balukoff.com', 'username': 'sbalukoff'}, {'_account_id': 14591, 'name': 'Lubosz Kosnik (diltram)', 'email': 'lubosz.kosnik@intel.com', 'username': 'diltram'}, {'_account_id': 16923, 'name': 'HP Octavia Sonar CI', 'email': 'octavia.sonar@gmail.com', 'username': 'octaviasonar', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-02 15:47:08.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Move bandit to pep8

The bandit gate is passing, let's make it voting.

Since bandit is a security linter, add it to the linter target - called
pep8 - and run it there. This will save the CI systems spawning an extra
test machine for this.

This is the recommended approach in OpenStack CI to run all linters as
part of pep8 target - see also the consistent testing interface for
python (http://governance.openstack.org/reference/cti/python_cti.html)
that associates pep8 with "Codestyle checks".

Change-Id: Id65a50c35723b79e9b92952d138e60ee998c341c
'}]
commit_message:
Move bandit to pep8

The bandit gate is passing, let's make it voting.

Since bandit is a security linter, add it to the linter target - called
pep8 - and run it there. This will save the CI systems spawning an extra
test machine for this.

This is the recommended approach in OpenStack CI to run all linters as
part of pep8 target - see also the consistent testing interface for
python (http://governance.openstack.org/reference/cti/python_cti.html)
that associates pep8 with "Codestyle checks".

Change-Id: Id65a50c35723b79e9b92952d138e60ee998c341c

Add the application log functionality to the dashboard

The dashboard plugin currently does not support the option to display the
logs for a selected application. This patch adds this option to the
dashboard plugin.

commit_message:
Change assertTrue(isinstance()) with optimal assert

Some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) .
The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A, B) provided by testtools

Change-Id: I94de7de376c0960881efbdbb356cdcaff8accbe2

Uncaught exceptions in the core or L3 plugin layers can cause the
auto_allocate plugin to fail unexpectedly. This patch ensures that

commit_message:
Deal with unknown exceptions during auto allocation

Uncaught exceptions in the core or L3 plugin layers can cause the
auto_allocate plugin to fail unexpectedly. This patch ensures that
any unexpected error is properly handled by cleaning up half
provisioned deployment.

Related-bug: #1612798
Closes-bug: #1619497

Change-Id: I3eb9efd33363045f7b2ccd97fe4a48891f48b161

commit_message:
Make service profiles default to rabbitmq_node_ips

Instead of hard-coded yaml aliases in t-h-t, make each service
profile that requires rabbit default to the list of rabbit ips.

Note this could still be extended in future to e.g enable per
service rabbit clusters, but the default is to lookup the
hiera which should be logically equivalent to current t-h-t.

Change-Id: Ie53c93456529420588eb1927703ea91b54095d87
Partially-Implements: blueprint custom-roles

commit_message:
Generate composable service node_names lists

Some puppet interfaces require a comma separated list of hostnames
where a service is running, so generate it in a similar way to th
service ips.

Change-Id: Icdf5d993d089dc94035194bdbd52299fcbc793be
Partially-Implements: blueprint custom-roles

commit_message:
Use assertIn instead of assertTrue(A in B)

Instead of using assertTrue(A in B ), developers should
use assertIn(A, B).

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I20a84a4b8feac498ddbf3123b6803f6f87cd3662

commit_message:
Simple instance allocations from resource tracker

This adds simple update/delete of allocations to the resource tracker
using existing places that determine our claim and tracking
processes.

Related to blueprint resource-providers-allocations

Change-Id: Ia250e6b1b65b16b0ecb97f5cf21e161ff511cb2a

commit_message:
Puppet4 support: fix noop launcher.

Prevent false positive results in cases when something
is wrong with the environment and tests have not started at all.

Related-Bug: 1586480

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-09-01 18:35:41.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py', 'nova/exception.py', 'nova/objects/resource_provider.py', 'nova/tests/functional/db/test_resource_provider.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_resource_provider.py'], 'message': 'Add create_all and delete_all for AllocationList

This is the object side of creating and deleting allocations in the
placement service.

create_all() checks that the inventory records involved in the
allocations requested do not have their capacities exceeded. If no
inventory capacities are exceeded, allocation records are written to the
database. Afterwards, the resource provider generation for each resource
provider involved in the allocation transaction has its generation
incremented. If another threads has concurrently updated either the
inventory or the usage of resources, this generation increment will
raise ConcurrentUpdateDetected, allowing callers to retry. This patch
does not yet implement this retry, which should be fine for the time
being considering that nothing yet calls POST /allocations.

Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools

Co-Authored-By: Jay Pipes <jaypipes@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ed Leafe <ed@leafe.com>

Change-Id: Ic0bb48dcb1ab33b278f09dee8778fcb7a374caad
'}]
commit_message:
Add create_all and delete_all for AllocationList

This is the object side of creating and deleting allocations in the
placement service.

create_all() checks that the inventory records involved in the
allocations requested do not have their capacities exceeded. If no
inventory capacities are exceeded, allocation records are written to the
database. Afterwards, the resource provider generation for each resource
provider involved in the allocation transaction has its generation
incremented. If another threads has concurrently updated either the
inventory or the usage of resources, this generation increment will
raise ConcurrentUpdateDetected, allowing callers to retry. This patch
does not yet implement this retry, which should be fine for the time
being considering that nothing yet calls POST /allocations.

Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools

Co-Authored-By: Jay Pipes <jaypipes@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ed Leafe <ed@leafe.com>

Change-Id: Ic0bb48dcb1ab33b278f09dee8778fcb7a374caad

commit_message:
Pull from cell0 and build_requests for instance list

In order to list instances in the brave new world of cellsv2 we must
aggregate results from the build_requests table in the api cell, cell0,
and the single(atm) actual cell. Note that there are no plans to make
filtering/sorting a list of instances work across multiple cells.

Change-Id: I625c7714fb04eb2bf07695fd7ec053a2f32c62bc
Partially-implements: bp add-buildrequest-obj
Partially-implements: bp cells-scheduling-interaction
Depends-On: I090d5994c3077d86c60457e4c16a03d35e0c409c

Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-01 16:44:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/volume/test_iscsi.py'], 'message': "Remove hacked test that fails with latest os-brick

The test here was slated for removal long ago when we
integrated os-brick since it had to be hacked to mock
out some internals of os-brick, which is terrible and
has finally come home to break this unit test with
os-brick 1.6.1, so let's just remove it.

commit_message:
Remove hacked test that fails with latest os-brick

The test here was slated for removal long ago when we
integrated os-brick since it had to be hacked to mock
out some internals of os-brick, which is terrible and
has finally come home to break this unit test with
os-brick 1.6.1, so let's just remove it.

Change-Id: If11d6b078199878f9074e6b87f56c6f76087bfd3
Related-Bug: #1618697

commit_message:
Fix doc build if git is absent

When building packages if git is absent, then we should not set
html_last_updated_fmt. It can still be set via the -D switch
when building with sphinx-build.

Change-Id: Ie6477df7f65e5035b1b03b51f698972ce9dd9aaa
Closes-Bug: #1552251

commit_message:
Report compute node inventories through placement

This makes the scheduler client report compute node resource
inventories via the placement API if possible.

Related to blueprint generic-resource-pools

Co-Authored-By: Sylvain Bauza <sbauza@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic1d0d15413e31a622dcca9ceaf588e805ac4aaba

This adds a feature to allow the user to include the HDP

commit_message:
Adds support for ambari-local option

This adds a feature to allow the user to include the HDP
repositories within the image. This is useful in helping speed up
the deployment process of Ambari based cluster deployments. Including
the repositories locally also reduces the need for a local webserver to host
the repositories.

Change-Id: I7982acc5365e30703b9f239f0dff9e76d2b4c0e6

commit_message:
Change CloudName default value to include domain

The CloudName's default value only included the shortname which is
not a very good practice. This now sets localdomain as the default
domain there.

Change-Id: Ic46b34d94a602aa948b873062015286cf49f7c3c

commit_message:
Return 400 error for non-existing snapshot_id

If you pass non-existing snapshot_id to the boot server api,
it returns HTTP 500 error.
This patch fixes this issue by catching SnapshotNotFound
exception and raising HTTPBadRequest in controller.

Closes-Bug: #1614097
Change-Id: Ieea5b4815e9078f9c22069a6fb772cd67b8de3a2

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-09-01 14:06:50.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': 'Delete BuildRequest regardless of service_version

Because an instance list will attempt to pull instances from the
build_requests table we should delete the BuildRequest when attempting
to delete an instance no matter what the minimum service version is.
However the deletion only affects the rest of the delete logic if the
service version is at a certain level.

Change-Id: I0637be3b9357de0f0f8fa2e7bae00859ccbe18e1
'}]
commit_message:
Delete BuildRequest regardless of service_version

Because an instance list will attempt to pull instances from the
build_requests table we should delete the BuildRequest when attempting
to delete an instance no matter what the minimum service version is.
However the deletion only affects the rest of the delete logic if the
service version is at a certain level.

commit_message:
Fix service version lookups

There is some cellsv2 code that's conditional upon the nova-api services
all being above a specific service version. However the lookup was
checking for the 'nova-api' service version which returns the default of
0 because the actual registered service is 'nova-os_compute'.

Change-Id: I97a5d8472cc09ae64203de1c91d0db6ec59d83de

Switch order for cleanup in NamespaceFixture

In case ensure_namespace fails for any reason, the ip_wrapper attribute
is not created but destroy(), that uses this attribute, is still called.

TrivialFix

[{'number': 21, 'created': '2016-09-02 05:09:35.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/update.py', 'doc/source/developing_guides/supportstatus.rst', 'heat/engine/support.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/software_deployment.py', 'heat/tests/test_stack_update.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py', 'heat_integrationtests/functional/test_replace_deprecated.py', 'heat/tests/test_resource.py'], 'message': 'Non-destructive upgrade for deprecated resources

If you attempt to update a stack containing
OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployments resources, so it uses the new
non-deprecated OS::Heat::SoftwareDeploymentGroup type instead, it
deletes the group, and all of the deployments.

This means that any deployment "actions" property will be
misinterpreted, e.g if you have actions: CREATE, all the deployments
will re-run on the update, even though it's an update, not a create.

This issue exists on all deprecated resoruces, when we trying to upgrade
to new version of it by update.

This patch fix above update issue by check if resoruce was deprecated
and been update by replacing resource (which is the parent class of
existing resource).

Change-Id: Ib7880120a90c4497a7ceea53eee55c220a28d14e
Closes-Bug: #1528958
'}]
commit_message:
Non-destructive upgrade for deprecated resources

If you attempt to update a stack containing
OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployments resources, so it uses the new
non-deprecated OS::Heat::SoftwareDeploymentGroup type instead, it
deletes the group, and all of the deployments.

This means that any deployment "actions" property will be
misinterpreted, e.g if you have actions: CREATE, all the deployments
will re-run on the update, even though it's an update, not a create.

This issue exists on all deprecated resoruces, when we trying to upgrade
to new version of it by update.

This patch fix above update issue by check if resoruce was deprecated
and been update by replacing resource (which is the parent class of
existing resource).

Change-Id: Ib7880120a90c4497a7ceea53eee55c220a28d14e
Closes-Bug: #1528958

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-09-02 11:18:09.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/CONTRACT_HEAD', 'neutron/tests/functional/scheduler/test_l3_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/scheduler/test_l3_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/scheduler/l3_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/db/l3_agentschedulers_db.py', 'neutron/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/newton/contract/2e0d7a8a1586_add_binding_index_to_routerl3agentbinding.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/db/migrations/test_2e0d7a8a1586_add_binding_index_to_routerl3agentbinding.py'], 'message': 'Add binding_index to RouterL3AgentBinding

The patch proposes adding a new binding_index to the
RouterL3AgentBinding table, with an additional Unique Constraint that
enforces a single <router_id, binding_id> per router. This goes a long
way into fixing 2 issues:

1. When scheduling a non-HA router, we only use binding_index=1. This
   means that only a single row containing that router_id can be
   committed into the database. This in fact prevents over-scheduling of
   non-HA routers. Note that for the HA router case, the binding_index
   is simply copied from the L3HARouterAgentPortBinding (since they are
   always created together they should always match).

2. This sets the ground-work for a refactor of the l3 scheduler - by
   using this binding and db-based limitation, we can schedule a router
   to agents using the RouterL3AgentBinding, while postponing the
   creation of L3HARouterAgentPortBinding objects for the agents until
   they ask for it (using sync_routers). This will be a major
   improvement over todays "everything can create
   L3HARouterAgentPortBinding" way of things).

Closes-Bug: #1535557
Change-Id: I3447ea5bcb7c57365c6f50efe12a1671e86588b3
'}]
commit_message:
Add binding_index to RouterL3AgentBinding

The patch proposes adding a new binding_index to the
RouterL3AgentBinding table, with an additional Unique Constraint that
enforces a single <router_id, binding_id> per router. This goes a long
way into fixing 2 issues:

1. When scheduling a non-HA router, we only use binding_index=1. This
   means that only a single row containing that router_id can be
   committed into the database. This in fact prevents over-scheduling of
   non-HA routers. Note that for the HA router case, the binding_index
   is simply copied from the L3HARouterAgentPortBinding (since they are
   always created together they should always match).

2. This sets the ground-work for a refactor of the l3 scheduler - by
   using this binding and db-based limitation, we can schedule a router
   to agents using the RouterL3AgentBinding, while postponing the
   creation of L3HARouterAgentPortBinding objects for the agents until
   they ask for it (using sync_routers). This will be a major
   improvement over todays "everything can create
   L3HARouterAgentPortBinding" way of things).

Closes-Bug: #1535557
Change-Id: I3447ea5bcb7c57365c6f50efe12a1671e86588b3

commit_message:
Remove left over conf placeholders

Lots of placeholders were added into conf/__init.py__ to reduce the
number of merge conflicts during the configuration refactoring. Now the
moves have been completed, we can remove the placeholders that were
never actually used.

blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

Change-Id: Ie207d6dbd5806c1e8b8937153ae9d74e147b1a11

commit_message:
Add share type change to Share Migration

This patch adds a 'new_share_type_id' parameter to Share Migration,
where the destination share can be provisioned under a different
share type of choice.

Host-assisted migration handles it by creating a totally new share,
as before.

Driver-assisted migration handles by creating the destination
instance model with the new share type, the driver is responsible
for making the necessary changes to satisfy the provided model.

In order to accomplish this, a database change was required,
transferring the 'share_type_id' field from the 'shares' table
to the 'share_instances' table.

APIImpact

Partially implements: blueprint newton-migration-improvements
Change-Id: I3200eaaa5b66d9b8ce1cbd16c1658db8516c70fb
